Returns: The number of bytes of data read, or zero if all of the entity's data has already been read.
Parameters: byte: Byte array to fill with data from the stream. If the stream does not have sufficient data to fill the array, then the contents of the remainder of the array will be undefined.
read(byte[]).Description: Read enough entity data into a byte array to fill the array.

Returns: The number of data bytes available, equivalent to calling @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput#getDataSize_E@ on the underlying @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput_E@.
size().Description: Report the total number of bytes of data available for the current entity.

Returns: The number of bytes of data read, or zero if all of the entity's data has already been read.
Parameters: byte: Byte array into which the data will be read
int: The data will be stored in b beginning at this index within the array.
int: The number of bytes to read in this operation. If insufficient data exists within the entity to fulfill this request, only as much data will be read as is available.

Returns: The byte read, or undefined if the end of the stream has been reached.
read().Description: Read one byte of entity data from the stream, returning it as an integer value. If more than @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInputStream#size_E@ bytes of data are read from the stream, the output of this method is undefined.

ClassDesc: Provides an @B_java#io#InputStream_E@-like interface for accessing an entity's data during a restore operation. Used by @B_android#app#backup#BackupHelper_E@ classes within the @B_android#app#backup#BackupAgentHelper_E@ mechanism. When @B_android#app#backup#BackupHelper#restoreEntity_E@ is called, the current entity's header has already been read from the underlying @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInput_E@. The entity's key string and total data size are available through this class's @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInputStream#getKey_E@ and @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInputStream#size_E@ methods, respectively. @B_android#app#backup#BackupDataInputStream#size_E@ bytes from the stream.
